review_text: Great service! Amazing food options for everyone! The staff goes out of their way to ensure a great dining experience. Highly recommend for happy hour, snacks and drinks,  or dinner!

name: Julie
review_text: We went after being open three weeks. Service was a little slow but everything else was perfect.

name: JohannaF
review_text: Very exciting to have a new beautiful restaurant with a creative and well executed menu in Breckenridge. Very diverse menu. Great cocktail menu and wines by the glass.  We ordered 2 starters and 3 shared plates which were all delicious. Don't miss the parker house rolls or the Hamachi!  We got the warm chocolate chip cookie dessert and were in heaven. So delicious. I will be going back soon!

name: NewWT
review_text: Stunning food and good service

name: MLREH
review_text: We thought every part of the meal was top shelf.   Extensive wine list.  Best dish was the trout.  Enjoyed a creamer brûlée with a fig sauce in a larger than normal portion.  Highly recommend and wish it was close to home.

name: GenaT
review_text: Truly amazing experience! We’ve spent the summer in Summit County and have tried many, many restaurants in the area. We decided to try a new place tonight and were so Impressed with their menu, their staff and the overall ambience. We will be going back as often as we can!!

name: DanB
review_text: This is a restaurant for those who appreciate good, interesting fresh food. So everyone! Enjoy!!!!

name: Miranda
review_text: This was the best fine dining experience we have had in Breckenridge. All of the snacks and small plates were delicious. Craft cocktails were divine. We will be back for more.

name: Hooty
review_text: In a word. Spectacular!!! Unfortunately i wasn’t that hungry but had made the reservation but My husband was quite hungry and we were both excited to go there since we had read so much about the place. Our server, Patrick, was top notch. I ordered the house Pinot noir which was gorgeous. My husband loved his summer ale.  I had an excellent Cesar salad that was a little different from the norm. My husband had the Colorado trout and it was off the charts. To top it off we had the crispy Brussels. They were outstanding the best I’ve ever had!!! Lastly we ordered the creme brûlée and, being a creme brûlée lover, it was hands down the best I’ve ever had. DO NOT MISS THIS WONDERFUL RESTAURANT!

name: OGmtnHapa
review_text: We liked our visit to this restaurant. With that said, the flavors were interesting -- not anything that said "wow!" per se, but there is a great mix of fusion flavor on this menu that would satisfy almost any palate.  The beef tartare flavor was reminiscent of a sloppy joe which is odd for a higher end restaurant. The Korean fried chicken dish was spicy, yet very tasty - the pickles were a nice addition to flavor here. Our entrees were *very* good, yet small. The cocktails were excellent and priced accordingly.  There were two duck confits and a filet at the table - all plates cleaned. Dessert was something I would skip in the future and perhaps replace with another shared plate. I liked this restaurant, but was not overly wowed by it. With a few drinks, expect to dish out about $100/person with gratuity. This is a bit hard to swallow for a mountain town that cannot necessarily be renowned for its dining options. Additionally, it is pretty loud in here, so expect to speak up in conversation.

name: EatAnythingAtleastOnce
review_text: We ordered the curried cauliflower, the fois gras, the risotto and the upside down cake as well as a drink each. We were not disappointed with the food. Best food we've had in the last 10 days in Vail, Breckenridge or Frisco. The ambience is nice but the noise level is less than ideal if you have a couple of noisy tables. It got difficult to hear the person across the table a couple of times. This is an expensive restaurant and I would definitely recommend it for special occasions as the quality of the food and drinks Ms is very very good.

name: Harold
review_text: The four of us were quite pleased with this new restaurant. Staff were well trained, cordial, and knowledgable. Food was very good and abundant.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_text:
My family and I had an outstanding  experience eating dinner at Aurum Breckenridge last night.

It opened just three weeks ago, but already has a strong following among locals in Breck, and with good reason.  The restaurant was built from scratch in one of the few formerly vacant lots in Breck, and the building is light, airy, and has a great vibe.  The servers were happy, attentive and helpful to all patrons and accommodated food allergies very well. The owner and the manager are very hands-on and asked about our meal.  They have an excellent wine list, and both traditional and specialty cocktails  which were terrific.  The food was superb, with a diverse offering with original twists.  Go there early to take advantage of happy hour pricing on some food, wine and cocktails.   

Overall, the attention to detail in every aspect really sets it apart.  Breckenridge has some truly great restaurants, and Aurum sits very near, if not at, the top of my list.  If you are anywhere  in Summit County, you owe it to yourself to check it out.

name: TeeGee
review_text: This was our 4th time and we found it exceptional. The staff is amazing.

name: kevinb
review_text: Food was perfectly cooked and perfectly flavored.   I hate ordering a medium-rare steak and receiving it well done and seasoned to death.   That did not happen here - Aurum's beef filet was cooked to perfection and had a great taste - not overwhelmed by salt or butter or whatever.  Just a really great cut of meat with just the right amount of seasoning.  Very cool and comfortable atmosphere as well.  I'll go back next time I'm in town!

name: COTraveler
review_text: We had a table of four. All were very pleased with all aspects. Service was attentive. I had made a note that I had dietary restrictions and made a request and they were ready for me when we arrived.  Much appreciated.  We had early reservations which turned out to be during happy hour. The group enjoyed selections from the Signature and Preserving the Past bar options.    The others then had the Crispy Curried Cauliflower and Korean Chicken appetizers.  The onto mains in which two had the Colorado Trout with Palisade peaches and another had the Kale salad. I with dietary restrictions had a veggie plate.  All were very good.  Rave reviews for the trout for how fresh it was and the unique paring with the peaches.  Refreshing new addition to the Breckenridge food scene.

name: Sunset
review_text: Very impressive new restaurant in Breckenridge. Happy Hour is a great deal - the cauliflower snack is delicious. Other favorites are the kale salad, the trout, and the peach upside down cake. This is my new go to restaurant!

name: ShannonL
review_text: Loved our first experience at this new restaurant in Breck. It was much noiser than I expected.  Don't know what they can do about that. Wine and food outstanding.

name: BarbaraM
review_text: Great food, service & ambiance!

name: DavidE
review_text: SUPERB can not describe the wonderful meal we had on Friday night.  The food was so tasty and the portions were perfect size to share. Our entire meal with dessert but no alcohol was surprisingly reasonable.  The Kale salad was not to our liking and they took it off our bill.   I recommend this restaurant anytime that you are in Breckenridge?

name: JaneyT
review_text: Great place for happy hour--terrific appetizers--but too noisy except in back room.

name: Excellent
review_text: Seating on time for our reservation . Excellent food and service for our three course meal. We’re locals and this is our new favorite spot.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_text: The food is fantastic and they have a nice outdoor patio. We visited twice during our 1 week in breck, and wanted to go again. The duck fat fries, corn risotto, brussel sprouts, and bone-in New York strip were all amazing. We visit breck 1-2 weeks a year and this is our new favorite restaurant.

name: OpenTable Diner
review_text: New kid on the block in Breckenridge. Delivers in every way! We went 3 times in 10 days. A Breckenridge must.

name: MCLbreckresident42yr
review_text: Great new place with nice facility, pleasant staff, and good food. Enjoyed our meal and the evening, thanks!

name: TomB
review_text: Food and service were excellent. Unfortunately, 30 minutes in they seated a party of 12 in the middle of the dining room. The 11 men and 1 women were extremely loud and the management did nothing to contain their noise. We had a hard time continuing our conversation with friends. Aurum is a nice restaurant but should either provide a private room or not allow large 8+ parties. They ruined everyone’s dining experience.

name: MarkG
review_text: One of the best restaurants in Breckenridge!  The happy hour is simply amazing.

name: Wiltcroft
review_text: Aurum just opened its doors and we’ve already been twice! Exciting spin on unique menu items makes this the number one Happy Hour and dinner spot in Breckenridge!  Just hope us locals don’t get pushed out because of the tourist traffic which will undoubtedly dominate the reservations once word gets around!  Would be nice if we could get some tables held back for locals.  👍👍👍

name: StephenL
review_text: Three nights in Breckenridge and three evening meals at Aurum!  My wife and I went there every night and this time Chelsea was not there but Mathew and all the others were more than up to the task.  Food was so great!  the menu was exactly the same and we had to have that Korean Chicken again along with the French Onion Burger but when they threw in the Parker house rolls with the butter...oh that butter....who is making this stuff!  It was so great!  We tried the Buttermilk Ricotta Cheese dish for the first time and it is super.  I am back home in Northern Colorado right now but if they ever fixed the roads here I might just drive up tonight!   The people are the added extra of so much fun to be around you want to just go back and wash the dishes.   What a great place, we will be back soon!

name: StephenL
review_text: Ok, so this is by far the greatest  restaurant in Summit County, Breckenridge Colorado!   By far.  We had a waitress, Chelsea that we couldn't tip enough to reward her for great service!  A vivacious young lady, she kept and eye on everything and everyone, funny,  great lady....and the food is clean, wholesome, perfect menu...just enough to give you a choice but not so much that they can't make it all to perfection in the back...whoever the chef is, isn't paid enough as the presentation and the taste of every meal was perfect...we are here for three nights from Fort Collins on a getaway with my lovely wife and we just stumbled onto this restaurant two nights ago, and went back last night and are going tonight!   We have never done this before!  The upside down peach desert was the greatest, if only it had two scoops of ice cream instead of one, I would have fallen out of my chair with happiness!  Kale Salad, great!  had it both nights!  Korean Fried Chicken last night...wow!!! crispy, spicy, not too spicy!    French Onion Burger, both nights....they figured out how to cook it just as I ordered it ..and melt the cheese to perfection!  Everyone go there...we will be there tonight

name: Tones
review_text: A fantastic addition to the Breckenridge Dining Scene! Wine list is superb.

name: Brecklocal
review_text:
The menu was very creative - and innovative. I personally loved the roasted carrots and the duck breast. Our waiter was very attentive - and helpful...

I'll be back sometime soon....

name: macsmak
review_text: We have dined at Aurum more than a handful of times since it opened a few weeks ago and just LOVE it! The food, the cocktails, the service, and the ambiance have made it our new favorite in Breckenridge. A must-visit!

name: RobertW
review_text: We arrived near the end of happy hour, and the restaurant was very busy.  They had only been open one week.  You could tell the staff was working hard to keep up, but everyone, including the owner, was pitching in.  Good vibe.  Excellent and creative food.  Good selection of starters and small plates.  Very good list of wines by the glass.  Short walk to the Riverwalk center, so it's a great place to eat before a show.  We'll be back.

name: number1foodie
review_text: Lovely new restaurant in Breckenridge. It was so good we went on consecutive nights. Beautiful dining room, wonderful food and attentive service. Highly recommended.

name: FromTulsa
review_text: Outstanding.  My new favorite in Breck. Will become very popular soon.

name: RichardV
review_text: We had a most pleasant experience at Aurum.  It is so nice to find a restaurant with an atmosphere that provides for conversation in a normal decibel level.  We didn't have to compete with loud, annoying music just to converse with one another.  The service was extra special with several of the restaurant staff checking to see that our every need was met.  Our waiter, Patrick, was very attentive.  It was a pleasure to meet chef Courtland.

name: Valerio
review_text: The quality of the food is outstanding, all four of us were very happy. Service was excellent and I would describe the ambiance as mountain modern.

name: Martin
review_text: Great food, choices, and service in a nice new location  Loved the Brussels sprouts! Same for the cauliflower and salmon. Only issue in the front right corner was acoustics--very loud.

name: wendye
review_text:
Excited to meet friends here for a nice dinner. All was very good, except that we felt rushed ordering and were told we had limited time at the table. We all ordered 2 drinks and would have had another all around but felt we were expected to leave. We all ordered full meals, as well. 
Food was fabulous and so were the staff that stopped by our table. We have not been asked to hurry it along in years. It really soured our experience. BTW, we are locals.

name: JudiH
review_text: Every bite was delicious! Welcome to Breck, Aurum.

name: Ess61
review_text: We had a fabulous meal at Aurum and superior service! The decor is stunning. What a gem for Breckenridge! We will absolutely be back.

name: Chris
review_text: Outstanding! Decor, service and food were all amazing! Great attention to detail. It was one of the best meals and experiences  we’ve had in Breck!

name: Pat1234
review_text: Excellent fresh food creatively displayed.  Owner and waiters friendly and service oriented.  Parker Rolls are to die for!  Entrance room where bar is is extremely noisy though.

name: Billy
review_text: Wait staff was great and food was delicious. There’s a beautiful A-frame bar in the front room along with seating and additional seating in the back room. If you’re sensitive to sound prefer to sit in the back room as it’s much quieter there.

name: DennisR
review_text: The menu choices were fabulous and those we had were excellent. The food was very attractively presented and the tastes were outstanding.

name: Lissa
review_text: Food was delicious! Server was attentive. But, the server was too loud. He took really good care of us, he just had a really loud laugh and voice and acted a little too familiar. Just needs some training and polishing. The room was pleasantly quiet with all tables filled with guests. It got loud when he entered. For a restaurant of this caliber and price, servers need to be discreet.

name: AdamE
review_text: Food and wine list were great and showed thought and creativity. We were really impressed with how well the service ran despite it being day 2 of their operation. We’d love to go back!

name: macsmak
review_text: From cocktails to food to service to ambience, Aurum is top notch! My salmon was fantastic and everyone in my family enjoyed their meal very much. Try the "milk and cookies" dessert!
